thread.title: Oddball brings big comedians, traffic woes to Dallas
thread.title_full: Oddball brings big comedians, traffic woes to Dallas

title: Oddball brings big comedians, traffic woes to Dallas
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Oddball brings big comedians, traffic woes to Dallas The final day of the State Fair of Texas along with the final tour stop of the Oddball Comedy Festival made for a not-so-funny traffic tie up that has left several people asking for refunds. Post to Facebook Oddball brings big comedians, traffic woes to Dallas The final day of the State Fair of Texas along with the final tour stop of the Oddball Comedy Festival made for a not-so-funny traffic tie up that has left several people asking for refunds. Check out this story on WFAA.com: http://on.wfaa.com/1LGx354 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Oddball brings big comedians, traffic woes to Dallas Jordan Armstrong, WFAA 12:33 p.m. CDT October 19, 2015 Oddball Comedy and Curiosity Festival (Photo: Marjorie Owens, WFAA) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
DALLAS -- The final day of the State Fair of Texas along with the final tour stop of the Funny or Die Presents: Oddball Comedy and Curiosity Festival made for a not-so-funny traffic tie up that has left several people on social media asking for refunds. 
Oddball Fest, which features comedians Aziz Ansari, Amy Schumer, Nick Kroll and many others, was held Sunday from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m. at Gexa Energy Pavilion, next door to Fair Park. 
Comedian Amy Schumer performs during the Oddball Comedy and Curiosity Festival at the Nikon at Jones Beach Theater on September 4, 2015 in Wantagh, United States. (Photo: Mike Pont/Getty Images) 
Due to it being the last day of the State Fair, several festival-goers say they were stuck in traffic for hours. 
"Traffic was a nightmare. I left home at 5:15 and the Google map said it would take about 45 minutes due to traffic," Aren Lackey said. "We got into the Gexa/Fair area by 6ish and then went less than two miles in the next hour. We gave up at about 7:20 after one of the traffic cops told us there was no Fair or Gexa parking available." 
The same message was repeated on social media. Last night the traffic to Oddball was so bad we bailed. $350 down the drain. Instead we went to A few bars. 

The first one was Clutch. Eve… — Ryan Stewman (@ryanstewman) October 19, 2015 @azizansari I have been in traffic for 2 hours trying to get to oddball fest please send help
